attributes.action: Ensure a new hospital is built central to all West Hertfordshire communities
attributes.background:
It must be purpose-built and equipped to modern standards with enough space for parking and future expansion.

We are members of the New Hospital Campaign formed to request a new hospital on a central, accessible site between the three main towns - Hemel Hempstead, St. Albans and Watford.
attributes.additional_details:
The local NHS is proposing to keep the Watford site in Vicarage Road as the acute hospital. This plan is not sustainable: it cannot meet the health needs of the people of the area. The estate requires Â£100m of backlog maintenance and cannot be brought up to modern standards. 

We need a new hospital that everyone can get to, which surveys have repeatedly shown patients want. The present hospital is in a congested corner of our area, next to the ground of a Premier League football club.

attributes.action: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders
attributes.background: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders and tougher conditions and limits on their human rights whilst in prison
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was attacked by a persistent offender and very seriously injured.  She subsequently died as a result of her injuries and the psychological impact of the assault.  This offender will remain a risk to other people if he is ever released.

attributes.action: Stop the CCG from cutting NHS funded IVF services in Suffolk.
attributes.background:
Keeping NHS funded IVF services will impact on so many people's lives by allowing them to have the family they've always wanted.
It would be so unfair to take away an opportunity for people to have a family when they cannot conceive themselves.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.hsj.co.uk/hsj-local/commissioners/nhs-ipswich-and-east-suffolk-ccg/more-south-east-ccgs-plan-cuts-to-ivf-services/7008343.fullarticle

attributes.action: Provide accessible mental health services for 18-30 year olds
attributes.background: Adult mental health services tend to cater for the middle-aged and the elderly in our society, not for the young adults who have just come out of CAMHS. Young adults who enter the services are faced with the battle to be properly supported, as the services are not suited to their specific needs.
attributes.additional_details:
As a result of not having a specialist young adults' service, young adults have been left to fend for themselves in a system that doesn't understand them; fighting to be recognised in hospitals which want to care for the middle-aged and elderly; less able to care for themselves due to a lack of proper support; and less likely to seek help with their mental health in the first place.

We ask you to consider putting some of the limited mental health funding towards a service for 18-30 year olds.

attributes.action: Stop NHS Trusts investigating their own practice and complaints.
attributes.background: Our sixteen-year-old son Elliot died three years ago following an operation to correct a broken collar bone.  Addenbrookes spent 18 months investigating and reporting on their own practice.  The report was incomplete, inaccurate and a number of discrepancies were highlighted by the Coroner.
attributes.additional_details: In the last three years, we have followed all the procedures and guidelines available to us.  We have complained to the GMC and The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman and we have attempted to take Addenbrookes to court with no success.  Today we were informed that because we have not followed the Addenbrookes complaint procedure to the letter the Ombudsman cannot proceed with their investigation and there is nothing they can do.  It is not right that the NHS Trusts are able to investigate and report on their own practice and when challenged by external organisations set up to protect the patient they are able to delay the process.

attributes.action: Refuges for domestic violence victims MUST be exempt from housing benefit cap.
attributes.background: Refuges for domestic violence victims rely on getting their full rent per room so they can stay open, some local authorities are already refusing funding in the belief that many of these desperately needed refuges may close when the cap is brought in. It is unacceptable that they lose any funding.
attributes.additional_details: As seen on BBC breakfast, these brave women and children will have nowhere else to go. Many don't have a secure location to escape to, and even in refuges can often be tracked down, and in extreme cases even killed. We must insure, not only that they stay open, but be better and more sustainably funded. We need many more refuges, not many less. Thousands of families of abusive partners owe their lives to these refuges, which give them a chance to change identity and live full and secure lives.

attributes.action: The removal of umbrella companies as payment option
attributes.background: We work on zero hour contracts which is fine because we are contractors but therefore we shouldn't be stung by payment companies charging us n.I contributions for both us and our employers

attributes.action: Make sure all disabled people can have the adaptations they need
attributes.background:
Disabled Facilities Grants adapt peopleâs homes to be safe and suitable.

Current funding is not enough to provide everyone with the adaptations they need. 

We petition you to calculate the annual need for DFG funding at a local authority level, and ensure that this funding need is met.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2011 report by the BRE stated: âthe total amount requiredâ¦ is Â£1.9bn.â

The total funding over the last 5 years was Â£1 billion - only half of whatâs needed.

Though funding will rise by 2019/20, there is no assurance that it will meet the need.

Isle of Wight Council have found that every Â£1 invested in DFGs could return Â£7.30 a year in social care savings.

In the past 5 years, the government may have missed savings of more than Â£47 billion in social care costs.

This needs to change.

Thank you.

attributes.action: Permanent 'dogs die in hot cars' signs to be in all public car parks.
attributes.background: Despite constant public messages and awareness raising people continue to leave their dogs locked in hot cars. This is unacceptable and many dogs suffer. The law is also very unclear on what direct action members of the public can take. A dog can die in the time it takes for police to attend.
attributes.additional_details: Permanent signs in all public car parks, give traffic wardens the power to break car window in an emergency and clear up and improve rights of the general public to intervene if necessary.

attributes.action: Give Ofcom power to enforce impartiality and accuracy of the BBC
attributes.background: Giving Ofcom the power to enforce this policy, for accurate information is essential to democracy. At present the BBC is failing the nation, discarding all pretence at impartiality and balanced reporting, becoming a voice for an international elite, & suppressing news not welcome to its own agenda.
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC has a unique position in British life; funded by the people individually, it belongs to all & has an ethical & constitutional duty to provide accurate & unbiased information & balanced comment. It has lamentably failed this duty in recent years, in Referendum debates, and even more so afterwards by hysterically talking down the future prospects of the country, increasing division, distrust, & anger & encouraging anxiety & fear in the young
more at http://www.facebook.com/BBCNewsPetition

attributes.action: Stop Britain from being subjected to all new EU regulations and treaty changes.
attributes.background: The British people democratically decided to leave the EU.  The government could have revoked the European Communities Act 1972 and left straight away.  However it has decided to use the much slower European Union Article 50 route.  It now makes no sense at all to be bound by any new EU legislation.
attributes.additional_details: At this point in time the EU Commission could rush through all manner of legislation to frustrate Britain's amicable exit from Europe.  They could at a stroke of a pen extend the time covered by Article 50 from two years to five or more.  They could bring in treaty change legislation to literally milk our country for all the money they can get before we leave.  This petition is designed to encourage our government politicians to seriously consider this eventuality and prevent it from happening.

attributes.action: Hold public consultation on NHS Sustainability and Transformation Footprints
attributes.background: By June 2016, forty four geographical areas in England are to produce a five year NHS Sustainability and Transformation plans showing that they would balance their budget by eliminating all deficits in this financial year and implement new models of care as laid out in the Five Year Forward View.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that this would have a profound effect on the delivery of local health services. It should be noted that none of these plans are based on evidence or assessment of clinical needs. Furthermore the plans have not been discussed in the House of Commons and there has been no public consultation. We demand that the government should launch an urgent public consultation on this major reorganisation of the NHS.

attributes.action: Improve Testing for Lyme disease in UK and Treatment Guidelines
attributes.background: Lyme disease within the UK is a big problem and the NHS is refusing to recognize this, leaving many patients to spend thousands on private treatment or suffer in silence

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pension funds to be plundered.
attributes.background: Once again an "entrepreneur" has plundered the pension fund of many working people - this time British Home Stores.  The shortfall will have to be met by the British Taxpayer while the "entrepreneur" walks away.
attributes.additional_details: When Robert Maxwell, another "entrepreneur", plundered pension funds  years ago there was a public outcry but nothing has been done to prevent this happening again.  Why not?  Pension funds should be ring-fenced so that they cannot be plundered.  The money which will have to be found to meet this pension gap would be spent better on doctors, nurses, the NHS in general, better treatment of the older generation and many other causes. Meanwhile the person responsible for this walks away.

attributes.action: Cats not in an approved breeding programme should be microchipped and neutered.
attributes.background: Female cats can become pregnant at 4 months and give birth at 6 months.  This is not good for anyone involved. A legal requirement for neutering, plus compulsory microchipping to enable cat owners to be identified, would prevent this happening, and also take the pressure off cat rescue centres.
attributes.additional_details: At my local rescue centre alone, there are presently around 40 kittens, and things will most likely get worse as the summer progresses.  It happens every year, and the situation is repeated in rescue centres up and down the country, mainly due to owner ignorance and/or lack of responsibility.  Compulsory microchipping and neutering of cats would go some way towards preventing this, and would result in happier, healthier cats.

attributes.action: Stop the sale and production of genetically modified foods in the uk
attributes.background: These foods are incredibly damaging to our health and environment. The dangers of genetically modified foods has been proven and other countries in Europe have already banned them. I believe that the people of the uk deserve safe nutritious food

attributes.action: Change law to make  Dog Owners responsible for their Dogs that attack Pets
attributes.background: Too many pets are being attacked by out of control dogs and nothing can be done about it as it's not a police matter.
attributes.additional_details: So let's see if we can change the law, as since 1871 the law says a dog on dog attack is not a police matter. This petition is to see if we can get the law changed that  owners of dogs with a history of aggression/attack MUST be on lead or muzzled if level of aggression is high in open/public spaces.

attributes.action: Review the limitations for Red Arrows air displays this year in particular FIA.
attributes.background: The new CAA regulations regarding air show displays have led to a review of the Red Arrow displays this year most importantly at the Farnborough International Airshow. The Red Arrows have always been an important part of the FIA, and safety has always been upmost in their display.

attributes.action: Don't tax Adult Colouring Books as they are a therapy
attributes.background: So I am an avid colouring therapy addict, just like thousands of people across the world and now the British government are trying to tax our therapy. We do this to escape from a lot of things in life for many it is the only luxury they have. Please don't tax our colour therapy

attributes.action: Protect and support the Forest of Dean wildlife especially the wild boar.
attributes.background: The Forest of Dean is unique. It is home to a vast array of wildlife including boar. The health of the wildlife is watched over by  charitable organisations. Because of the nature of the forest it's not unusual for boar to roam in to areas populated by humans. This isn't taken to kindly.
attributes.additional_details: It is our belief that such wild animals will only breed to their environment and if left alone will not over breed. We would like a vast majority of the forest to be a safe zone for our wildlife. And we would like full support for the charities and education to residents in the forest that the flora, fauna and wildlife should be cherished as an I portent part of our heritage.

attributes.action: Ensure that the Brexit EU deal maintains free trade, research, and movement.
attributes.background: After the Leave vote, we must ensure that the rights and prosperity of UK citizens are protected. We believe that this means any deal should ensure our rights as UK citizens to live and work around the EU, maintain single market access to protect British jobs, and continue academic collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: Such a deal would likely be similar to that between the EU and Norway; whilst this may involve the UK continuing to pay some EU budget contributions, we accept the views of most economists that single market access is valuable enough to make this worthwhile. This deal will likely involve accepting free movement into Britain, too, and we welcome this; EU migrants are at the heart of British life, playing a vital role in many economic sectors but more importantly being our neighbours and friends.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory voting and also a 'none of the above' box on ballot papers
attributes.background: With constant low turnouts for UK elections it always favours the establishment as they will always get their voters out which can be enough in areas who only have 30/40% turnout. We favour an Australian-style compulsory voting as long as they got a 'none of the above' box on the ballot paper.

attributes.action: Ban disposable plastic crockery and cutlery to help the environment
attributes.background: Recently France became the first country to pass an all-out ban on plastic cutlery, plates, and cups. Let's follow their example through a ban on disposable plastic tableware. These plastics affect our environment and use fossil fuels. Plastic pollution is a pervasive issue but we can change this.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastics are extremely durable, lightweight, cheap and versatile - features which mean that they have replaced many traditional materials such as metal, glass and wood. Unfortunately these features make them the most pervasive, persistent and hazardous form of litter in our environment. 

Furthermore, plastic manufacturing is estimated to use 8 percent of yearly global oil production. This precious resource is being wasted on disposable products for 'convenience'. This is not sustainable.

attributes.action: Parliament debates the legality of EU treaties with regard to Vienna Convention.
attributes.background:
Article 53, Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties: 1969 states:  'A treaty is void if, at the time of its conclusion, it conflicts with a peremptory norm of general international law.'  

Peremptory norm includes the removal of sovereignty and the removal of law not specifically repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
It is recognised that EU Treaties entail removal of National Sovereignty and abrogate National Law not specifically repealed which includes the Treason Laws.   Parliament is sovereign except that it shall not diminish its own sovereignty.

As Parliament at various times has seen fit to transfer sovereignty to the EU, it is illegal under International Law and should cease forthwith including any procedures laid down by the EU for secession from the EU and withdraw unilaterally,

attributes.action: Legislation that requires all products list their content of aluminium as mg/L
attributes.background: Aluminium is ubiquitous in everyday products. Human exposure to aluminium is rising every year. Contrary to the official view that aluminium is benign in humans, there is growing research showing myriad links with neurological conditions such as Alzheimer's disease.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike almost any other known toxin, there is no legislation to limit human exposure to aluminium and no legal requirement to list its content on any product. This petition asks that the public be informed about their unwitting exposure to aluminium in everyday life.
For more information visit: keele.ac.uk/aluminium

attributes.action: Provide funding for a specialist music teacher in every primary school.
attributes.background: The racism and xenophobia surrounding the EU Referendum has demonstrated the need for better music education in our schools in order to teach our children about other cultures, create safe spaces where children feel a sense of well-being, joy, togetherness and purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Primary schools often don't have a specialist; budgets are squeezed. Music stimulates cognitive development, enhancing everything from language to mathematics and empathy; it helps children to succeed at school and far into adulthood. The younger we learn the better. The experience of music allows children to build human understanding across differences of âculture, creed, and race. Music-making builds a happy society: you make friends in choirs and orchestras; concerts are uplifting.

attributes.action: Scrap Energy Performance Certificates
attributes.background: EPCs (Energy Performance Certificates) were introduced as a mandatory requirement for all UK residential property sales from 2007 (originally as part of the failed Home Information Pack). This derived from an EU diktat, European Union Directive 2002/91/EC. Later, this applied to rental properties

attributes.action: Ensure that the United Kingdom remains in the European Economic Area (EEA)
attributes.background: On 23 June the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union. The outcome of the referendum must now be respected. However, over 48% of voters expressed a desire to remain in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: For well over a generation, we have taken for granted the economic, political and travel benefits of EU - and EEC - membership. While there is now a popular mandate for a negotiated withdrawal from the EU, it is also essential that the interests be respected of over 48% of voters who wish to retain the benefits of being in the EU. The best way to do this is through membership of the European Economic Area (EEA).

attributes.action: Childcare providers should be paid by direct payment
attributes.background: Parents/ Carers claiming the childcare element for childcare get paid into their accounts and then pass it on to their childcare provider. As a childcare provider I think it would be easier by paying the provider direct by the Inland Revenue.

attributes.action: Reconsider legisltive changes that are intended to apply to the BSPS Pension
attributes.background: Steelworkers have worked in the industry under TATA management. They paid into the pension scheme, that had defined benefits on retirement. Its wrong that an ex employee should have that entitlement reduced whilst several known branches of the company continue to extract revenue from our economy.

attributes.action: Investigate an incinerator at Rivenhall outputting 500,000 tonnes of CO2
attributes.background: In 2010 the secretary of state approved an IWMF at Rivenhall with bio mass generator and an incinerators for solid recovered fuels. This was approved for planning without an EA permit on the 26th Feb 2016 via a S73 variation that reduces Bio Mass by 70% whilst increasing Incinerated waste by 60%
attributes.additional_details: The new plant now produces only 28Mw power is being built at risk (no EA permit) and is relying on the change process. The changes in the plant capacities move it DOWN the wast hierarchy not up. The new plant will disperse poisonous gasses over Essex prime farm land and historic housing. In addition the plant will produce some 500,000 tones of CO2 that is totally contrary to the current thinking and is not sustainable. The planners have allowed this to progress at risk.

attributes.action: Save the Battle of Britain display at the Royal Aircraft Museum.
attributes.background: While at the RAF Museum I saw that many of the exhibits in the Battle of Britain Hall were being dismantled.  It appears the BoB Museum will be no more and the aircraft therein will be dispersed, either to areas within the Hendon site, RAF Cosford or put in storage.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts to offer a minimum of 2 funded fertility treatments.
attributes.background:
We have been struggling with infertilty for the last 6 years, we have had various drugs and one Funded IVF cycle.
We got pregnant with IVF. Our baby boy was born pre-term (18wks) and didn't survive. 
This petition is to help others in a similar circumstance to us, to have another NHS funded cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Not all NHS trusts offer the same amount funded cycles.

attributes.action: Stop the Children and Social Work Bill 2016
attributes.background: The government is trying to pass a bill that includes a section that would allow local councils to apply to be exempt from child protection laws. This is an appalling abuse of power and another attack on the rights of the most vulnerable in our society.
attributes.additional_details: www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2016-2017/0057/17057.pdf

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in London to become an independent city state
attributes.background:
The EU referendum has shown a significant disparity between the future that Londoners see for themselves and that of the rest of the country. 
Citizens of an independent London may be more prosperous and happy as a city state and being members of the EU.

attributes.action: Ensure NIPT users can access unbiased, balanced advice post prenatal screening
attributes.background: Non Invasive Prenatal Testing may soon be available on the NHS to prenatally identify a number of conditions. Sign this petition to ensure the government offer balanced, unbiased advice on both termination AND life experiences of people with diagnosed conditions, informed by lived experience.
attributes.additional_details: Diagnosis of an unexpected condition or potential disability during a pregnancy can impact families in a number of ways. There may be feelings of shock, grief, guilt and uncertainty. At this vulnerable time it is imperative that parents are given fast, free and easy access to a professional or team of professionals who can assist them with provision of unbiased and balanced information that covers the spectrum of experience and scientific evidence concerning their particular circumstances.

attributes.action: To make trespass a criminal offence.
attributes.background: To make trespass a criminal offence, to prevent travellers and others, setting up illegal sites. To prevent the illegal use of private and common land, which also brings with it the problems of illegal waste and unsanitary conditions.

attributes.action: Remove all French words from the cover of new British passports.
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU means people voted to Take Back Control. Control of their borders, their culture and their language. Whether 'Dieu et mon droit' and 'Honi qui mal y pense' have existed as mottos in England for ages is irrelevant. French is an EU language and has no place on a UK passport.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid & use the money to increase the defence budget and armed forces
attributes.background:
We believe the the Government should reduce the Foreign Aid budget back to Â£8.4bn, the level it was at in 2010.
The Foreign Aid budget is set to rise to almost Â£16bn by 2020.
We believe this additional funding should be moved to beef up our defence capabilities and our marvellous armed forces.
attributes.additional_details:
The Foreign Aid budget is too high and is subject to abuse.
We believe that the budget should be reduced to Â£8.4bn & the commitment of a minimum of 2% GDP on defence spending is increased.
Our armed forces are amongst the best in the world.
We should reflect this by boosting our defence budget & spending on our armed forces.
In an ever more dangerous world, we should spend more on beefing up our defence budget.
We believe that the best way to achieve this is to cut Foreign Aid & boost Defence

attributes.action: Restrict the sale of animals on the Internet.
attributes.background: I'm sick of finding out about and reading stories about poor, innocent animals sold on or given away on Gumtree and similar sites ending up as fighting dogs and bait etc. By restricting these sales, so many animals could be saved from horrific fates but I need YOUR help to make this happen!

attributes.action: To fund research for hidradenitis suppurativa  (HS) to get the knowledge to GP's
attributes.background: I have HS as do many of us here in the UK. HS is a painful skin disease thats courses boil like abscesses that affect the armpit, breast, groin and pubic area. It can effect people mentally as well as physically, like many ive had time of work due to the pain and after having surgery.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with this diseases for the past 5 to 6 year and havent got any closer to any kind of relief from the pain the past year i have had 4 operations and now the surgeon's will not see me until i have seen the dermatologist, its a daily battle with my pain. Im not the only one that suffers on a daily basis with the pain and embarrassment of this dreadful disease. We need to see more support for people suffering and GP's and other professionals getting the knowledge to help us.

attributes.action: To abolish the tv licence fee completely
attributes.background: I am trying to get the outdated tv licence fee abolished and let it get private donations like sky or virgin

attributes.action: Make DWP disability assessment providers supply video recording equipment.
attributes.background: Many people attending disability assessments have memory problems and cannot remember what was said and done during their face to face assessments. Providing a video recording of this assessment is a reasonable adjustment in the same way ramps are for wheelchair users and Braille is for the blind.
attributes.additional_details:
Additionally there seems to be a lot of corrupt assessors out there who are making a mockery of the system. As the only evidence that can prove an assessor lied is the recording of the assessment which they often refuse to allow it leaves the system in their favour. As we are often told if you are doing nothing wrong then you have nothing to hide. 

So should we record so the disabled person can remember or not record it so the assessor can lie.

attributes.action: Immediate force to combat  suicides in Veterans and Members of our Armed Forces
attributes.background: More Veterans and serving men and women killed them selves in 2012 than were lost during the Afghan war.
attributes.additional_details:
The facts speak for them selves. The deaths are continuing to rise and the government and parliament must make the forming of this force a priority .More Falkland veterans have killed them selves than were actually killed  during the Conflict in 1982.
We demand an immediate force of Veterans and professional people  be made into a new force which will be given priority, to help and stop our veterans and serving forces killing them selves.

attributes.action: Stop the persecution of Zander in British canals, rivers and ponds.
attributes.background: Zander have been in England since 1878 and today hold great interest with anglers as a superb sporting fish. Their effect on tackle trade is marked as so many lure anglers spend a lot of money on all the accoutrements needed to successfully target the species.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of money is wasted trying to iradicate Zander from our waters by the Canal & Rivers Trust and yet modern anglers love to fish for them. Modern lure angling also offers children a great way of enjoying this traditional sport and Zander are a big part of the inner city street angling scene.

attributes.action: All official campaign material for UK elections must be fact checked
attributes.background: We need to stop inaccurate or misleading information in official campaign materiel in elections and referendums (posters, leaflets posted to people, TV broadcasted, etc.). A neutral third party could be used to do this.
attributes.additional_details:
During the recent Brexit campaign, both slides used statistics that were widely regarded to be inaccurate - this needs to stop. 

In the past we could count on the media to do this, but it appears that we can no longer do this. 

We have official statistics and official and impartial organizations who publish statistics and perform fact checking these can be used.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of Paignton and Brixham hospitals, Devon.
attributes.background: Torbay is struggling to cope as it is and it will be the elderly patients that will suffer further.

attributes.action: Call Government to legislate & implement Lynn Faulds Wood Consumer Recall Report
attributes.background: The Lynn Faulds Wood review calls for an overhaul of the consumer product recall system in this country. This has been highlighted by the situation with Whirlpool. Without Government legislation, as one MP stated, companies will continue with 'corporate malpractice' with no thought for the consumer.
attributes.additional_details:
UK consumer product recall, An independent review by Lynn Faulds Wood
Adjournment debate by Andy Slaughter MP, Faulty Tumble Dryers (Fire Risk) on 13th September 2016

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid courses more accessible regarding location and cost
attributes.background: Mental Health First Aid courses teach how to identify the signs of key mental health issues, provide initial help and capably guide someone towards suitable support. Despite its benefits, many people haven't heard of MHFA; the course is not affordable for all (Â£300 per person) and centres are scarce
attributes.additional_details:
Mental ill health costs companies Â£26 billion and affects 25% of people, while the annual cost to the NHS is predicted to double over the next 20 years from Â£105 billion. With fast diagnosis and application of viable treatment, this could be alleviated.
Our NCS Social Action project (government scheme run by Catch 22) aims to increase MHFA accessibility, thus enhancing mental health care and awareness, developing community support by removing stigmas and advancing knowledge.
www.mhfaengland.org

attributes.action: Revisit case law that states Zimbabwe is a safe destination.
attributes.background: The country guidance for Zimbabwe last updated in 2013 currently being used by Home Office to determine asylum cases is outdated. The case law that states that Zimbabwe is a safe destination for failed asylum seekers needs to be revisited as recent atrocities tell  a different story.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some of the links that show the real & current situation in Zimbabwe:
 http://zimbabwerise.com/full-list-of-mugabes-terror-attacks-across-zimbabwe
http://nehandaradio.com/2016/09/21/shocking-pictures-showing-police-brutality-zimbabwe/
http://www.hrforumzim.org/category/reports-on-political-violence/
http://nehandaradio.com/tag/political-violence-in-zimbabwe/
https://www.hrw.org/world-report/2016/country-chapters/zimbabwe
